p: Lastly, there is growing recognition that qualitative research enriches our understanding of the acceptability, context, barriers, and facilitators of HIV care and treatment interventions [ 56]. To understand how vulnerable patients cope with a new HIV diagnosis in the context of iART, as well as the promise and perils of iART in a diverse population in terms of race, ethnicity, gender, and sexual orientation, an in-depth exploration of the role of stigma and mistrust is required. This deep understanding gained from qualitative research may help devise effective interventions that lay the foundation for an iART model rooted in health equity.
